intro: Argostemma neurocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, white to pale pink, and clustered in cymes, often with five petals. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
